name: Activate
shortDesctiption:
AWS Activate is a program designed to provide startups with the resources they need to get started on Amazon Web Services (AWS). It provides startups with access to credits, training, and support to help them quickly get up and running on AWS.
There are two tiers of the AWS Activate program: the AWS Activate Portfolio and the AWS Activate Platform.
The AWS Activate Portfolio is for startups that have received venture capital, equity investment, or grants. It provides startups with credits, support, and training to help them get started on AWS.
The AWS Activate Platform is for startups that are part of a startup accelerator, incubator, or seed stage funding program. It provides startups with credits and support to help them get started on AWS.
Both tiers of the AWS Activate program provide startups with access to AWS experts and a variety of resources, including:
- Credits: Startup companies can receive credits to help cover their AWS usage costs.
- Training and resources: Startup companies can access online training and resources to help them learn how to use AWS.
- Support: Startup companies can get support from AWS experts to help them get started on AWS.

The AWS Activate program is designed to help startups get started quickly and easily on AWS, so they can focus on building and growing their businesses.

name: Amplify
shortDesctiption:
AWS Amplify is a set of tools and services that helps developers build, deploy, and manage cloud-powered applications. It provides a set of libraries, UI components, and a command-line interface (CLI) to build mobile and web applications powered by AWS services.

One of the main features of AWS Amplify is the ability to set up and manage a cloud-powered back-end for your application with just a few lines of code. This back-end can include features such as storage, database, authentication, and serverless functions, among others.

AWS Amplify also provides a set of UI components that you can use to build the front-end of your application. These components are designed to work with the AWS back-end and can be easily customized to fit the needs of your application.

In addition to these features, AWS Amplify also provides a CLI that you can use to set up and manage your cloud resources, as well as to deploy your application to the cloud.

Overall, AWS Amplify is a powerful set of tools and services that makes it easy for developers to build, deploy, and manage cloud-powered applications. It provides a simple and flexible way to build applications powered by AWS services, without the need to manage the underlying infrastructure.

name: App Mesh
shortDesctiption:
AWS App Mesh is a service mesh that makes it easy to monitor and control microservices running on Amazon Web Services (AWS). It provides a set of APIs and tools for creating and managing a mesh of services, as well as for monitoring and securing communication between those services.
A service mesh is a transparent infrastructure layer that allows you to manage communication between your microservices. It gives you visibility into the health and performance of your microservices, as well as the ability to monitor and control the traffic between them.
AWS App Mesh is designed to work with Amazon ECS, Amazon EKS, and Kubernetes on AWS. It provides integration with these container orchestration platforms, making it easy to set up and manage a service mesh for your microservices.
AWS App Mesh provides features such as:
- Traffic routing: You can use App Mesh to route traffic between your microservices based on service-level objectives such as latency and error rates.
- Resiliency: App Mesh provides features such as retries and timeouts to help your microservices handle failures and errors.
- Observability: App Mesh provides detailed metrics and logs for your microservices, making it easy to monitor the health and performance of your application.
- Security: App Mesh integrates with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) and supports mutual TLS authentication to secure communication between your microservices.

Overall, AWS App Mesh is a powerful tool for managing and monitoring microservices running on AWS. It provides a set of APIs and tools for creating and managing a service mesh, as well as for monitoring and securing communication between your microservices.

name: App Runner
shortDesctiption:
AWS App Runner is a fully managed service that makes it easy to build, deploy, and run containerized applications on AWS. It provides a user-friendly interface for defining and deploying your application, as well as for scaling and managing it once it is running.

With AWS App Runner, you can define your application using a simple YAML configuration file that specifies the containers and resources your application needs. App Runner then takes care of building and deploying your application, as well as managing the underlying infrastructure.

App Runner integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon ECR (for container images) and Amazon ECS (for container orchestration), making it easy to build and deploy applications that are powered by these services.

AWS App Runner provides features such as:

- A simple and intuitive user interface for building and deploying applications
- Automated build and deployment pipelines for fast and reliable updates to your application
- Scaling and resource management to ensure that your application has the resources it needs to run smoothly
- Integration with other AWS services such as Amazon ECR and Amazon ECS

Overall, AWS App Runner is a fully managed service that makes it easy to build, deploy, and run containerized applications on AWS. It provides a user-friendly interface and integrates with other AWS services to make it easy to build and manage cloud-powered applications.

name: AppConfig
shortDesctiption:
AWS AppConfig is a service that helps you to easily and quickly deploy application configurations. It provides a way to define and store configurations in a central location, as well as to roll out configurations to your applications in a controlled and monitored way.

With AWS AppConfig, you can define your application configurations in a central location, such as an Amazon S3 bucket or an AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store parameter. You can then use AppConfig to roll out these configurations to your applications, either on a schedule or on-demand.

AppConfig provides features such as:

- Deployment policies: You can use deployment policies to control how configurations are rolled out to your applications. For example, you can specify a percentage of users to receive the new configuration, or you can specify a time window for the rollout.
- Monitoring and feedback: AppConfig provides detailed monitoring and feedback on the status of your configuration deployments, including error rates and success rates.
- Integration with other AWS services: AppConfig integrates with other AWS services such as AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CodeDeploy, making it easy to build and manage a continuous delivery workflow for your configurations.

Overall, AWS AppConfig is a useful service for deploying and managing application configurations. It provides a central location for storing and managing configurations, as well as tools for rolling out configurations to your applications in a controlled and monitored way.

name: AppSync
shortDesctiption:
AWS AppSync is a fully managed service that makes it easy to build and deploy serverless applications. It provides a way to create and manage a cloud-powered GraphQL API for your application, as well as to interact with data stored in other AWS services such as Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon S3.

With AWS AppSync, you can create a GraphQL API for your application by defining the data types and operations that you want to expose. AppSync then generates the API and handles all of the underlying infrastructure and scaling, allowing you to focus on building your application.

AWS AppSync provides features such as:

- Real-time data: You can use AppSync to build real-time applications by subscribing to data updates and receiving notifications when data changes.
- Offline support: AppSync supports offline data access and synchronization, allowing your application to continue to function even when it is not connected to the internet.
- Data synchronization: You can use AppSync to synchronize data between devices and servers, making it easy to build applications that work across multiple devices.
- Security: AppSync integrates with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) and supports OAuth and OpenID Connect for user authentication.

Overall, AWS AppSync is a fully managed service that makes it easy to build and deploy serverless applications. It provides a way to create and manage a cloud-powered GraphQL API for your application, as well as to interact with data stored in other AWS services.

name: Application Auto Scaling
shortDesctiption:
AWS Application Auto Scaling is a service that allows you to automatically scale your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources in response to changing demand. It enables you to set up automatic scaling for Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon ECS tasks, Amazon DynamoDB tables and indexes, and Amazon Aurora Replicas.

Application Auto Scaling helps you to ensure that your resources are always able to meet the demands of your applications, without the need for manual intervention. It does this by monitoring the performance of your resources and automatically scaling them up or down based on predetermined scaling policies.

With Application Auto Scaling, you can:

- Set up automatic scaling for Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon ECS tasks, Amazon DynamoDB tables and indexes, and Amazon Aurora Replicas.
- Use predefined scaling policies or create your own custom policies to specify when and how to scale your resources.
- Monitor the performance of your resources and receive alerts when there are issues or when scaling actions are taken.
- Take advantage of integration with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Lambda to build custom scaling solutions.

Overall, AWS Application Auto Scaling is a useful service for automatically scaling your AWS resources in response to changing demand. It enables you to set up automatic scaling and provides integration with other AWS services to help you build custom scaling solutions.

name: Application Cost Profiler
shortDesctiption:
AWS Application Cost Profiler is a service that helps you to understand the cost of running your applications on Amazon Web Services (AWS). It provides a way to analyze your AWS cost and usage data and identify opportunities for cost optimization.

Application Cost Profiler analyzes your AWS cost and usage data and generates recommendations for reducing costs. It provides recommendations at the resource level, such as Amazon EC2 instances or Amazon RDS databases, as well as at the application level, such as specific microservices or workloads.

Application Cost Profiler provides features such as:

- Cost optimization recommendations: Application Cost Profiler analyzes your AWS cost and usage data and provides recommendations for reducing costs.
- Customized recommendations: You can specify your business goals and cost optimization priorities, and Application Cost Profiler will generate customized recommendations based on these priorities.
- Integration with other AWS services: Application Cost Profiler integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Cost Explorer, providing a comprehensive view of your AWS costs and usage.

Overall, AWS Application Cost Profiler is a useful service for understanding the cost of running your applications on AWS. It provides recommendations for reducing costs and integrates with other AWS services to provide a comprehensive view of your AWS costs and usage.

name: Application Discovery Service
shortDesctiption:
AWS Application Discovery Service is a fully managed service that helps you to identify the applications running in your on-premises data centers, as well as the dependencies between them. It provides a way to discover and document your on-premises infrastructure and applications, as well as to migrate them to the cloud.

Application Discovery Service performs an automated discovery of your on-premises applications and their dependencies, and generates a map of your infrastructure. It can discover a wide range of applications, including custom and third-party applications, as well as infrastructure components such as servers and network devices.

Application Discovery Service provides features such as:

- Automated discovery: Application Discovery Service performs an automated discovery of your on-premises applications and their dependencies, and generates a map of your infrastructure.
- Dependency mapping: Application Discovery Service provides a detailed map of the dependencies between your on-premises applications, making it easier to understand how they work together.
- Cloud migration support: You can use Application Discovery Service to discover and document your on-premises infrastructure and applications, as well as to migrate them to the cloud.

Overall, AWS Application Discovery Service is a fully managed service that helps you to identify the applications running in your on-premises data centers, as well as the dependencies between them. It provides a way to discover and document your on-premises infrastructure and applications, as well as to migrate them to the cloud.

name: Application Migration Service
shortDesctiption:
AWS Application Migration Service is a fully managed service that helps you to migrate your applications to the cloud. It provides a way to migrate your applications to AWS quickly and easily, with minimal downtime and no need to rewrite your application code.

Application Migration Service provides a range of tools and services to help you migrate your applications to AWS. It supports a variety of migration scenarios, including migrations from on-premises data centers, other cloud environments, and remote desktop environments.

With Application Migration Service, you can:

- Migrate your applications to AWS quickly and easily, with minimal downtime and no need to rewrite your application code.
- Use a range of tools and services to migrate your applications, including the AWS Server Migration Service, the AWS Database Migration Service, and the AWS Migration Hub.
- Monitor and track the progress of your migrations using the AWS Migration Hub.

Overall, AWS Application Migration Service is a fully managed service that helps you to migrate your applications to the cloud. It provides a range of tools and services to help you migrate your applications quickly and easily, with minimal downtime and no need to rewrite your application code.

name: Artifact
shortDesctiption:
AWS Artifact is a portal that provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and select online agreements. These reports and agreements pertain to various AWS services and compliance frameworks, such as PCI DSS, SOC, and ISO.

AWS Artifact allows you to access and download the following types of documents:

- Compliance reports: These are reports that provide information about the compliance of AWS services with various regulatory frameworks.
- Online agreements: These are legal agreements that outline the terms and conditions for using specific AWS services.

AWS Artifact is intended to help customers who need to demonstrate compliance with various regulatory frameworks, as well as to review and accept online agreements for AWS services. It provides an easy-to-use portal for accessing the compliance reports and online agreements that are relevant to your use of AWS services.

name: Audit Manager
shortDesctiption:
AWS Audit Manager is a fully managed service that helps you to automate the auditing process for your AWS infrastructure and applications. It provides a way to create and manage assessments of your AWS resources, as well as to document and review findings from those assessments.

With AWS Audit Manager, you can:

- Create and manage assessments of your AWS resources: You can use Audit Manager to define the scope and objectives of your assessments, as well as to specify the AWS accounts and resources that you want to include in the assessment.
- Document and review findings from assessments: Audit Manager provides tools for documenting and reviewing the findings from your assessments, including the ability to add comments and annotations, and to track the status of findings.
- Automate the auditing process: Audit Manager provides a range of features to help you automate the auditing process, including the ability to schedule assessments and to generate reports.

Overall, AWS Audit Manager is a fully managed service that helps you to automate the auditing process for your AWS infrastructure and applications. It provides tools for creating and managing assessments, as well as for documenting and reviewing findings from those assessments.

name: Auto Scaling
shortDesctiption:
AWS Auto Scaling is a service that allows you to automatically scale your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources in response to changing demand. It enables you to set up automatic scaling for Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon ECS tasks, Amazon DynamoDB tables and indexes, and Amazon Aurora Replicas.

Auto Scaling helps you to ensure that your resources are always able to meet the demands of your applications, without the need for manual intervention. It does this by monitoring the performance of your resources and automatically scaling them up or down based on predetermined scaling policies.

With Auto Scaling, you can:

- Set up automatic scaling for Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon ECS tasks, Amazon DynamoDB tables and indexes, and Amazon Aurora Replicas.
- Use predefined scaling policies or create your own custom policies to specify when and how to scale your resources.
- Monitor the performance of your resources and receive alerts when there are issues or when scaling actions are taken.
- Take advantage of integration with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Lambda to build custom scaling solutions.

Overall, AWS Auto Scaling is a useful service for automatically scaling your AWS resources in response to changing demand. It enables you to set up automatic scaling and provides integration with other AWS services to help you build custom scaling solutions.

name: Backint Agent
shortDesctiption:
AWS Backint Agent is a software agent that enables you to use the AWS Backup service to back up data from your on-premises storage systems to AWS. It is designed to work with a range of storage systems, including those from vendors such as NetApp, HPE, and EMC.

With AWS Backint Agent, you can:

- Use the AWS Backup service to back up data from your on-premises storage systems to AWS.
- Schedule automated backups of your data and specify retention policies to control how long backups are retained.
- Monitor the status of your backups and receive notifications when there are issues or when backups are completed.
- Restore data from backups as needed.
AWS Backint Agent is a useful tool for backing up data from your on-premises storage systems to AWS. It provides integration with the AWS Backup service, making it easy to set up and manage automated backups of your data.

name: Backup
shortDesctiption:
AWS Backup is a fully managed service that makes it easy to back up data from your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources. It provides a centralized location for storing and managing your backups, as well as tools for scheduling and automating backups of your data.

With AWS Backup, you can:

- Back up data from a wide range of AWS resources, including Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon EBS volumes, Amazon RDS databases, and Amazon DynamoDB tables.
- Schedule automated backups of your data and specify retention policies to control how long backups are retained.
- Monitor the status of your backups and receive notifications when there are issues or when backups are completed.
- Restore data from backups as needed.

AWS Backup is a useful service for backing up data from your AWS resources. It provides a centralized location for storing and managing your backups, as well as tools for scheduling and automating backups of your data.

name: Batch
shortDesctiption:
AWS Batch is a fully managed service that makes it easy to run batch computing workloads on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud. It allows you to run batch jobs of any scale, without the need to provision, manage, or scale the underlying infrastructure.

With AWS Batch, you can define and submit batch jobs, and AWS Batch will take care of the underlying infrastructure and scaling required to run your jobs. You can specify the resources and dependencies required for your jobs, and AWS Batch will automatically schedule and run your jobs on the most appropriate infrastructure.

AWS Batch provides features such as:

- Job scheduling: AWS Batch automatically schedules and runs your batch jobs, based on the resources and dependencies you specify.
- Resource management: AWS Batch provides automatic scaling of the underlying infrastructure based on the needs of your batch jobs.
- Integration with other AWS services: AWS Batch integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon S3 and Amazon ECR, making it easy to run batch jobs that utilize these services.

Overall, AWS Batch is a fully managed service that makes it easy to run batch computing workloads on the AWS cloud. It allows you to run batch jobs of any scale, without the need to provision, manage, or scale the underlying infrastructure.

name: Billing Conductor
shortDesctiption:
AWS Billing Conductor is a fully managed service that helps you to optimize your Amazon Web Services (AWS) cost and usage by providing a way to analyze and optimize your AWS billing data. It provides tools and insights to help you understand your AWS cost and usage patterns, as well as to identify opportunities for cost optimization.

With AWS Billing Conductor, you can:

- Analyze your AWS cost and usage data: Billing Conductor provides tools for analyzing and visualizing your AWS cost and usage data, including detailed breakdowns of your costs by service, region, and account.
- Identify opportunities for cost optimization: Billing Conductor provides recommendations for reducing your AWS costs based on your cost and usage patterns.
- Monitor your cost and usage: Billing Conductor provides alerts and notifications when your cost or usage exceeds specified thresholds, helping you to stay on top of your AWS spending.

Overall, AWS Billing Conductor is a fully managed service that helps you to optimize your AWS cost and usage. It provides tools and insights to help you understand your AWS cost and usage patterns, as well as to identify opportunities for cost optimization.

name: Budgets
shortDesctiption:
AWS Budgets is a service that helps you to monitor and control your Amazon Web Services (AWS) spending. It provides a way to set up budgets that track your AWS costs and usage, and to receive alerts when your actual costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount.

With AWS Budgets, you can:

- Set up budgets that track your AWS costs and usage: You can create budgets that track your AWS costs and usage by service, by account, or across your entire organization.
- Receive alerts when your costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount: You can specify the threshold at which you want to receive alerts, and AWS Budgets will send you notifications when your actual costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount.
- Monitor your AWS spending: AWS Budgets provides detailed reports and visualizations that help you to understand your AWS spending, including breakdowns of your costs by service, region, and account.

Overall, AWS Budgets is a useful service for monitoring and controlling your AWS spending. It provides a way to set up budgets that track your AWS costs and usage, and to receive alerts when your actual costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount.

name: Certificate Manager
shortDesctiption:
AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) is a service that makes it easy to provision, manage, and deploy Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) certificates for use with Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources. It provides a central location for storing, managing, and deploying your SSL/TLS certificates, and integrates with other AWS services such as Elastic Load Balancing and Amazon CloudFront.

With ACM, you can:

- Request and manage SSL/TLS certificates: You can use ACM to request and manage SSL/TLS certificates for your domains, including certificates for wildcard domains and multi-domain certificates.
- Automatically deploy certificates: ACM integrates with other AWS services such as Elastic Load Balancing and Amazon CloudFront, allowing you to automatically deploy your SSL/TLS certificates to these services.
- Monitor certificate expiration: ACM provides alerts when your SSL/TLS certificates are due to expire, helping you to avoid disruptions to your service.

Overall, AWS Certificate Manager is a useful service for provisioning, managing, and deploying SSL/TLS certificates for use with AWS resources. It provides a central location for storing, managing, and deploying your certificates, and integrates with other AWS services.

name: Chatbot
shortDesctiption:
AWS Chatbot is a service that allows you to use Amazon Chime chat rooms or Slack channels to receive alerts, run commands, and take actions in response to those alerts and commands. It provides a way to use chat rooms and channels as an interface for interacting with your AWS resources, and integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Lambda.

With AWS Chatbot, you can:

- Use chat rooms or channels to receive alerts and run commands: You can set up AWS Chatbot to send alerts and run commands in response to events or conditions that you specify.
- Take actions in response to alerts and commands: You can use AWS Chatbot to trigger actions such as scaling resources or running custom scripts in response to alerts and commands.
- Integrate with other AWS services: AWS Chatbot integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Lambda, allowing you to use chat rooms and channels as an interface for interacting with those services.

Overall, AWS Chatbot is a useful service for using chat rooms and channels as an interface for interacting with your AWS resources. It provides a way to receive alerts, run commands, and take actions in response to those alerts and commands, and integrates with other AWS services.

name: Client VPN
shortDesctiption:
AWS Client VPN is a fully managed service that enables you to securely access your Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and your on-premises data centers over an IPsec VPN connection. It provides a way to establish a secure, encrypted connection between your VPC and your on-premises network, and integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Directory Service.

With AWS Client VPN, you can:

- Securely access your Amazon VPC and your on-premises data centers over an IPsec VPN connection.
- Use Active Directory or a self-managed OpenLDAP directory to manage access to your resources.
- Monitor the status of your VPN connections using Amazon CloudWatch.

Overall, AWS Client VPN is a fully managed service that enables you to securely access your Amazon VPC and your on-premises data centers over an IPsec VPN connection. It provides a way to establish a secure, encrypted connection between your VPC and your on-premises network, and integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS Directory Service.

name: Cloud Control API
shortDesctiption:
The AWS Cloud Control API is a set of APIs that allows you to programmatically manage your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources. It provides a way to automate tasks such as provisioning and managing resources, and to interact with other AWS services such as Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3.

The AWS Cloud Control API consists of a number of individual APIs, each of which provides access to a specific set of AWS resources and functionality. For example, the Amazon EC2 API allows you to manage your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances, while the Amazon S3 API allows you to manage your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) buckets and objects.

With the AWS Cloud Control API, you can:

- Programmatically manage your AWS resources: You can use the AWS Cloud Control API to automate tasks such as provisioning and managing resources.
- Interact with other AWS services: You can use the AWS Cloud Control API to interact with other AWS services such as Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3.
- Build custom applications: You can use the AWS Cloud Control API to build custom applications that interact with your AWS resources and services.

Overall, the AWS Cloud Control API is a useful tool for programmatically managing your AWS resources and interacting with other AWS services. It provides a way to automate tasks and build custom applications that work with your AWS resources.

name: Cloud Development Kit (CDK)
shortDesctiption:
The AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) is a software development framework for defining cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation. It allows you to use familiar programming languages, such as TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, C#, and Java, to build cloud infrastructure in an organized and predictable manner.

With the CDK, you can:

- Use familiar programming languages to define cloud infrastructure: You can use the CDK to define cloud infrastructure using programming languages such as TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, C#, and Java.
- Use AWS CloudFormation constructs to define your infrastructure: The CDK provides a library of constructs that you can use to define your cloud infrastructure in a way that is familiar to users of AWS CloudFormation.
- Provision your infrastructure through AWS CloudFormation: The CDK compiles your infrastructure definitions into AWS CloudFormation templates and provisions your infrastructure through CloudFormation.

Overall, the AWS Cloud Development Kit is a software development framework for defining cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation. It allows you to use familiar programming languages to build cloud infrastructure in an organized and predictable manner.

name: Cloud Map
shortDesctiption:
AWS Cloud Map is a service that makes it easy to discover and connect to resources that are hosted in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud. It provides a way to register and discover resources such as web services, databases, and file storage systems, and to connect to them using domain names and other identifying information.

With AWS Cloud Map, you can:

- Register resources: You can use AWS Cloud Map to register your resources with a unique identifier and metadata such as a domain name, IP address, or port number.
- Discover resources: You can use AWS Cloud Map to discover resources that are registered with the service, using their unique identifier or metadata such as a domain name.
- Connect to resources: You can use AWS Cloud Map to connect to your resources using their unique identifier or metadata, without the need to hardcode specific IP addresses or port numbers.

Overall, AWS Cloud Map is a useful service for discovering and connecting to resources that are hosted in the AWS cloud. It provides a way to register and discover resources, and to connect to them using domain names and other identifying information.

name: Cloud WAN
shortDesctiption:
AWS Cloud WAN (AWS Wavelength) is a service that enables you to build applications that have low latency and high performance for users on 5G devices. It does this by providing access to compute and storage resources that are physically located in the same data centers as major mobile network operators (MNOs).

With AWS Cloud WAN, you can:

- Build applications with low latency and high performance: AWS Cloud WAN provides access to compute and storage resources that are physically located in the same data centers as MNOs, enabling you to build applications with low latency and high performance for users on 5G devices.
- Use familiar AWS tools and services: AWS Cloud WAN is fully integrated with other AWS services, allowing you to use familiar tools and services such as Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3 to build and deploy your applications.
- Scale your applications as needed: AWS Cloud WAN provides the ability to scale your applications as needed to meet the demands of your users.

Overall, AWS Cloud WAN is a service that enables you to build applications with low latency and high performance for users on 5G devices. It provides access to compute and storage resources that are physically located in the same data centers as MNOs, and is fully integrated with other AWS services.

shortDesctiption:
AWS Cloud WAN (AWS Wavelength) is a service that enables you to build applications that have low latency and high performance for users on 5G devices. It does this by providing access to compute and storage resources that are physically located in the same data centers as major mobile network operators (MNOs).

With AWS Cloud WAN, you can:

name: CloudFormation
shortDesctiption:
AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you to create and manage infrastructure for your applications in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud. It provides a way to use templates to define your infrastructure as code, and to automate the process of creating and managing your infrastructure.

With AWS CloudFormation, you can:

- Define your infrastructure as code: You can use templates written in JSON or YAML to define your infrastructure in a way that is easy to understand and maintain.
- Automate the process of creating and managing your infrastructure: You can use CloudFormation to automate the process of creating and managing your infrastructure, including tasks such as provisioning and configuring resources.
- Version and manage your infrastructure: CloudFormation allows you to version your templates and infrastructure, and to use features such as stacksets to manage infrastructure across multiple accounts and regions.

Overall, AWS CloudFormation is a useful service for creating and managing infrastructure for your applications in the AWS cloud. It provides a way to define your infrastructure as code, and to automate the process of creating and managing your infrastructure.

name: CloudHSM
shortDesctiption:
AWS CloudHSM is a service that provides hardware security modules (HSMs) in the cloud. HSMs are physical devices that provide a secure environment for generating, storing, and managing cryptographic keys. They are often used to secure sensitive data such as encryption keys and digital certificates.

With AWS CloudHSM, you can:

- Use HSMs in the cloud: You can use CloudHSM to access HSMs in the cloud, rather than having to purchase and maintain your own HSMs.
- Generate, store, and manage cryptographic keys: You can use CloudHSM to generate, store, and manage cryptographic keys in a secure environment.
- Integrate with other AWS services: CloudHSM integrates with other AWS services such as Amazon S3 and Amazon RDS, allowing you to use your HSMs to secure data in these services.

Overall, AWS CloudHSM is a service that provides hardware security modules (HSMs) in the cloud. It allows you to use HSMs in the cloud to generate, store, and manage cryptographic keys, and integrates with other AWS services.

name: CloudShell
shortDesctiption:
AWS CloudShell is a service that provides a browser-based shell for interacting with the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud. It allows you to run commands and scripts, and to manage your AWS resources using a web-based command line interface (CLI).

With AWS CloudShell, you can:

- Use a web-based CLI to manage your AWS resources: You can use CloudShell to run commands and scripts, and to manage your AWS resources using a web-based CLI.
- Access a pre-authenticated CLI: CloudShell provides a pre-authenticated CLI, allowing you to access your AWS resources without the need to manually authenticate.
- Collaborate with others: CloudShell allows you to share your CloudShell environment with others, enabling collaborative work on AWS resources.

Overall, AWS CloudShell is a service that provides a browser-based shell for interacting with the AWS cloud. It allows you to run commands and scripts, and to manage your AWS resources using a web-based CLI.

name: CloudTrail
shortDesctiption:
AWS CloudTrail is a service that enables you to track changes to your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources and to log those changes. It provides a way to audit and monitor activity in your AWS account, and can help you to identify and troubleshoot issues, as well as to meet compliance requirements.

With AWS CloudTrail, you can:

- Track changes to your AWS resources: CloudTrail logs changes to your AWS resources, including information about who made the change and when it was made.
- Monitor activity in your AWS account: CloudTrail provides a record of activity in your AWS account, allowing you to monitor for unusual or unauthorized activity.
- Identify and troubleshoot issues: You can use CloudTrail to identify and troubleshoot issues by reviewing the log data it provides.

name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
shortDesctiption:
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a web service that helps you securely control access to AWS resources. With IAM, you can create and manage AWS users and groups, and use permissions to allow and deny their access to AWS resources.

IAM is designed to help you manage access to your AWS resources in a secure and scalable way. Some of the key features of IAM include:

- Users and groups: IAM allows you to create AWS users and groups, and assign permissions to them that control their access to AWS resources.
- Policies: IAM uses policies to allow or deny access to AWS resources. You can create and attach policies to users and groups, and use them to specify the actions that users and groups can take and the resources they can access.
- MFA (multi-factor authentication): IAM supports MFA, which adds an additional layer of security by requiring users to provide a second form of authentication in addition to their user name and password.
- Identity federation: IAM allows you to use external identity providers (such as Active Directory, Google, or Facebook) to manage access to your AWS resources. This allows you to use your existing identity infrastructure to control access to your AWS resources.

Overall, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a web service that helps you securely control access to AWS resources. It allows you to create and manage AWS users and groups, and use permissions to allow and deny their access to AWS resources.

name: Athena
shortDesctiption: AWS Athena is a serverless service that allows you to make queries using ANSI SQL in data stored on Amazon S3. It supports a wide variety of data formats like CSV, TSV, JSON, or Textfiles. You pay for reading data and you can read compressed data like Zip or Gzip, so if you have 10GB CSV but it is only 20Mb Zipped, you can just upload a zipped version and query it while zipped, you will pay for 20Mb of reading instead of 10Gb or read. Nothing to maintain, and super-duper fast, querying multiple GB of data in seconds.

name: Aurora
shortDesctiption: AWS Aurora is a fully managed MySQL-compatible (or PostgresSQL) relational database, on top of RDS, with high speed and availability (sometimes 5x faster than traditional MySQL). You can chose provisioned Aurora that manages the server's instances sizes, or serverless (with a min and max resources) that can be scaled down to zero, allowing you to not pay 24/7 for that backend app that is only used once a month. The first query (cold start) can take a few seconds but then it will adapt to your needs.

name: DynamoDB
shortDesctiption: AWS DynamoDB is a serverless NoSQL database, in reality, it is a key-valued or wide column database with a single-digit millisecond response that scales to the moon. Some say it is the KingDB because it's truly created to scale to Terabytes of data, but each record can only store a max of 400kb. There are some limitations on the way you create its schema and how you query data, but when you unleash its true power you understand why it exists.

name: EC2
shortDesctiption: AWS EC2 it's a web service (APIs) to launch and manage Linux or Windows Servers on AWS Data centers, with a lot of flavors in terms of CPUs architectures and sizes, different amounts of RAM, GPU, Storage, and Networking. It's the heart of AWS but could be seen as VPS on steroids. Users need to patch and maintain APP software and OS on these machines.

name: ElastiCache
shortDesctiption: AWS ElastiCache offers managed caching service for Redis and Memcached, allowing you to unlock microseconds latency and scale with in-memory caching without focusing on servers. Accelerate applications performance, reduce backend database load.

name: Elastic Container Service (ECS)
shortDesctiption: AWS ECS is a fully managed container orchestration service built by Amazon. It makes it easy to deploy, manage and scale containerized applications. It supports Docker containers and you can run your containers on EC2 machines, Fargate (see below), or on-premises with (ECS Anywhere installed on your machines). You just need to create a Cluster, Tasks-definitions and run them either as Tasks (short-lived / batch containers) or as Services (24/7 workloads like webservers). You can choose x86 or arm64 processors and Linux or windows runtimes.

name: Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS)
shortDesctiption: WS EKS is a managed and certified Kubernetes service, allowing you to run Kubernetes on AWS or on-premises with some abstraction from the clusters configuration and host machine maintenance, letting you focus on conquering the world with your fleed of Pods.

name: Kinesis
shortDesctiption: AWS Kinesis is a serverless service that allows you to collect, process, analyze video or data streams in real-time. For example, you can stream video from a security camera and do face detection or machine learning. You can also stream stock market data and act on it with real-time buy and sell actions. Have in mind that there could be a delay in data up to 1 second.

name: Lightsail
shortDesctiption: AWS Lightsail is a simplified version of AWS EC2, it is a VPS that is in direct competition with DigitalOcean or Linode, offering you a simple payment system with integrated backup solutions, Security Group management, Server status, Bandwith, and much more, on a user-friendly Graphical Web Interface. Probably a way to welcome VPS clients from other providers to the AWS ecosystem.

name: QuickSight
shortDesctiption: AWS QuickSight is a serverless Business Intelligence service, it allows everyone in your organization to understand your data by asking questions in natural language, exploring dashboards, and finding patterns and outliers, using machine learning.

name: RDS
shortDesctiption: AWS RDS allows you easily set up and operate relational databases in the cloud. Run Databases without focusing on administrative tasks like hardware provisioning, database setup, patching, and backups. It supports Aurora, MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server.

name: Redshift
shortDesctiption: AWS Redshift is a fully managed data warehouse service at petabyte-scale. It uses SQL to analyze structured and semi-structured data across data warehouses, operational databases, and data lakes. It leverages AWS custom-designed hardware and machine learning to deliver the best performance at any scale.

name: Simple Notification Service (SNS)
shortDesctiption: AWS SNS is a serverless service that allows you to notify one or multiple services in a Publisher-Subscriber architecture (1-to-N). It can be used to send events from one server to multiple services (ex.: Lambda) or even to people (via e-mail or SMS). Messages are sent as arrive and if destinations are offline they don't have a mechanism to recover past messages (there's no guarantee of the event to arrive at all destinations)

name: Simple Queue Service (SQS)
shortDesctiption: AWS SQS is a serverless system that allows you to decouple systems on your architecture, by enabling one system to send events to another even if they are offline. It implements a Producer-Consumer architecture (1-to-1) and it buffers the information if not consumed immediately or if there are a big burst of events produced. It's normally used to make services very scalable and reliable, and to protect slow backends from a big burst of requests. Information can be consumed at a different rate than it's produced. Each event has a max size of 256Kb, so you will need to combine with another mechanism (ex.: S3) to send larger payloads.

name: WorkSpaces
shortDesctiption: AWS WorkSpaces is a fully managed desktop virtualization service that enables you to access data or applications remotely. Great to offer scalability or better performance machines to your organization's colleagues. It Facilitates remote work or onboard contingent workers or even creates powerful AutoCad machines that can be accessed from cheap low speck laptops.
